SEARCH

Package net.tangly.core.domain

package net.tangly.core.domain
The package defines the core abstractions for a bounded domain implementation. Entities defined in the domain can have oid, id, name, tags and comments. The realm interface is the entry point for the repository and factory abstractions. Repositories retrieve domain objects from persistence technologies. Factories create new object trees. The regular persistence approach is based on EclipseStore. The solution is well integrated in Java so that retrieval and creation operations are simple to implement.

The key abstractions are:

Bounded Domain
Defines the bounded domain model and the domain services.
Realm
Defines the repositories interfaces to retrieve all domain entities.
Port
Port interface for all inbound and outbound communication.

The user interface is an optional port. We support Vaadin based user interfaces.

The REST interface is an optional port. We use Javalin and OpenAPI to build a REST interface to the domain.

Creating a New Bounded Domain

Define Domain Entities
The domain entities are defined as regular Java classes and records. Per convention all classes are defined in the package DOMANIN_NAME.domain.
Define the interfaces to the Bounded Domain

Per convention all classes are defined in the package DOMAIN.services

  • The bounded domain class DOMAINBoundedDomain defines all the instances defining the bounded domain. It implements the BoundedDomain interface.
  • The realm DOMAINRealm defines the repository interface. It implements the Realm interface.
  • The port DOMAINPort defies the default port interface. It implements the Port interface. This interface defines the import, export and clear functions for the bounded domain.
  • The optional DOMAINBusinesLogic class defines business logic functions. It does not implement any specific interface.
Define the implementation of all service interfaces

Per convention all classes are defined in the package DOMAIN.ports.

  • Implement the realm interface. Per convention the class is called DOMAINEntities. Use the Provider abstractions to provide persistence with EclipseStore.
  • Implement the port interface. Per convention the class is called DOMAINAdapter.
  • Define the TSV Handler to enalbe the adapter to import entities from a TSV file and export them to a TSV file.

  • Class
    Description
    BoundedDomain<R extends Realm,B,P extends Port<R>>
    A bounded domain as defined in the DDD approach has a domain-specific model and a set of adapters.
    DomainEntity<T>
    Define the meta-information describing the characteristics of a domain entity.
    Port<R extends Realm>
    Define the inbound and outbound communication port to the bounded domain.
    Realm
    The realm is responsible for the handling of entities and value objects part of the domain model.
